original_title: Sri Lanka rupee strengthens to 318/320 to US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee strengthened to 318/320 to the US dollar Monday, dealers said, a few days after banks were told to go easy on squaring net open positions on a bond exchange, while bond yields closed lower.
Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe warned last week that the rupee was not a “one way bet”.
Given the past conduct of the central bank where it busted the rupee from 4.70 to 360 through its life, after getting powers to inject money and mis-target rates, market participants are jittery.

The rupee is under an IMF backed ad hoc peg mechanism called the ‘flexible exchange rate’ the latest confidence busting regime peddled by Western Mercantilists to countries without a doctrinal foundation in sound money, critics say.
The regime, without a consistent exchange rate policy, is found in several countries that defaulted recently.

Under the regime all monetary policy errors involving cutting rates with inflationary open market operations are heaped on the currency, imposing regressive inflation taxes on the poor through higher food and energy prices in particular while wages lag behind.

Earlier regimes peddled by Western Mercantilist to trigger instability and impose regressive inflation taxes on the poor through depreciation, included money supply targeting with reserve collection, basket band crawl (BBC) policy, a type of NEER targeting, as well as REER targeting.

Sri Lanka’s central bank now conducting broadly deflationary policy and the currency can be stabilized with moral suasion or signalling. The strategy was followed in two flexible exchange rate episodes this year.
Moral suasion however works only if open market operations are deflationary.
The rupee closed at 328.00/329.00 to the US dollar in the spot market Friday.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 closed at 13.80/14.00 percent down from Friday’s closed at 14.15/30 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 closed at 13.95/14.10 percent down from closing at 14.40/50 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 14.45/65 percent down from closing at 14.95/15.05 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 14.75/85 percent down from closing at 15.15/20 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 15.20/50 percent down from closing at 15.60/80 percent. (Colombo/July28/2023)
